meanings.definition: To calm or soothe someone who is angry or upset.
meanings.sent1: She tried to pacify her crying baby by rocking him gently.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used a soothing voice to pacify the upset student.
meanings.sent3: He quickly realized that offering a pacifying hug was the best way to calm his friend down.
meanings.sent4: The music had a magical ability to pacify even the most agitated souls.
meanings.sent5: The warm tea seemed to pacify her nerves before the important presentation.

meanings.definition: To bring peace to a situation or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The negotiator's skillful words helped pacify the tense meeting.
meanings.sent2: The treaty was signed to pacify the warring nations.
meanings.sent3: The calming presence of the mediator was enough to pacify the heated argument.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to pacify any disagreement in the room.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset seemed to pacify the chaos of the city streets.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something less aggressive or hostile.
meanings.sent1: The trainer used treats to pacify the aggressive dog.
meanings.sent2: His apology was meant to pacify her hurt feelings.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes had a way of pacifying even the angriest audience members.
meanings.sent4: The gentle touch of a friend can sometimes pacify the most hostile emotions.
meanings.sent5: The kind gesture was enough to pacify the angry customer.
